text: Josh Boateng (born 28 March 1997) is a Grenadian Shot Put and Discus thrower.And National Record holder in both eventshttps://www.iaaf.org/athletes/grenada/josh-boateng-293393 He is also the current National Junior Record Holder in the Discus. == College career == === 2018 === On 20 January 2018 he broke the National Record (Indoor) Shot Put throw of 16.77m at the Pima Aztec Indoor Invitational in Tucson Arizona.http://pima-aztec-indoor- invitational.runnerspace.com/eprofile.php?event_id=10678&do;=news&year;=2018&pg;=1&news;_id=507062&folder;_id=0#news On 24 March 2018 he reset the Outdoor Shot Put Record with a throw of 17.78m at the UTEP Springtime Invitational.http://utep- springtime.runnerspace.com/eprofile.php?event_id=10907&year;=2018&do;=info He further improved on the Shot Put record on 3 May at the NJCAA Region I Track & Field Championships in Mesa Arizona with a throw of 18.08m.http://www.regiononecctf.com/results/track/2018/180503NJCAARegionIResults.html He further went on to increase to 18.11m in a second place finish at the NJCAA Division I Outdoor Championships and won the discus competition with a throw of 55.97m. === 2019 === Josh began his 2019 season representing for the Texas A&M; University-Commerce at the Pittsburg State Invitational on the 26th of January.https://lionathletics.com/news/2019/1/26/mens-track-and-field-lion- records-fall-at-pittsburg-state-invitational.aspx His 17.41m throw served as both a New School Record as well as a Grenadian Indoor Record. He went on to improve on those records with a 17.77 at the Gorillahttps://lionathletics.com/news/2019/2/9/lions-wrap-up-indoor-regular- season-at-gorilla-classic.aspx Classic meet on the 9th February.https://www.commercejournal.com/sports/a-m-commerce-indoor- tracksters-set-some-best-marks- in/article_81b844ee-2fb4-11e9-8b70-b7ec6a73ebab.html He went on to win the Lone Star Conference Indoor Championships at Texas Tech University on February 17 with a 17.69m performance at Shot Put.https://lionathletics.com/news/2019/2/17/clark-and-sveard-dominate-lion- women-and-men-each-finish-third-at-lsc-championships.aspx On March 29 at the Clyde Littlefield Texas Relays, Josh was able to equal his own Grenadian National Record in the Shot Put. He also had a 56.80mhttps://www.commercejournal.com/sports/records-fall-for-lions-at-texas- relays/article_0d18bd1c-564c-11e9-8d10-8381803029e7.html performance in the Discus.https://lionathletics.com/news/2019/3/30/mens-track-and-field-records- fall-and-top-marks-set-for-lions-at-texas-relays.aspx As a result of these performances he was to be named Lone Star Conference Athlete of the Week for the second time.https://lionathletics.com/news/2019/4/3/mens-track-and-field- minna-svaerd-josh-boateng-earn-lsc-track-field-athletes-of-the-week.aspx On the following week Josh claimed the National Discus Record with a throw of 59.37 thus breaking the 15 year old record.https://lionathletics.com/news/2019/4/6/mens-track-and-field-pair- of-15-year-old-records-fall-for-lions-at-david-noble-relays.aspx He earn a third consecutive Lone Star Conference co-Field Athlete of the Week nod for his efforts.https://lionathletics.com/news/2019/4/10/mens-track-and-field- josh-boateng-wins-third-consecutive-lsc-field-athlete-of-the-week.aspx On the 11th of April at the East Texas Invitational he further extended his National Record to 60.77m. In doing so he also broke a thirty six year old school record.http://www.gilmermirror.com/view/full_story/27638415/article-TEXAS-A-M- COMMERCE-TRACK---FIELD--Four-school-records-fall-as-Lions-take-both-team- titles-at-East-Texas-Invitational?instance=home_news_bullets He received his fourth consecutive selection as athlete of the week in the Lonestar Conference.https://lionathletics.com/news/2019/4/17/boateng-clark-and-coby- pick-up-lsc-athlete-of-the-week-awards.aspx On April 25, 2019 at Abilene Christian University's Oliver Jackson Twilight Josh extended his National and School Record in the Discus Throw to 61m. He first Athlete from his school to ever go over 200 feet at 61.00 meters (200-1), notching the fourth-longest throw in Division II history all- time.https://lionathletics.com/news/2019/4/25/mens-track-and-field-lions-post- three-top-marks-in-lsc-closing-regular-season-at-oliver-jackson- twilight.aspxhttps://lionathletics.com/documents/2019/4/25//oj_2019_pdf_results.pdf Following this performance he was named USTFCCCA Division II athlete of the weekhttps://lionathletics.com/news/2019/4/30/mens-track-and-field-josh- boateng-named-ustfccca-national-athlete-of-the- week.aspxhttp://www.ustfccca.org/2019/04/featured/ncaa-njcaa-otf-national- athletes-of-the-week-april-30#ncaad2m He went on to be named USTFCCCA South Central Region Field Athlete of the Year.https://lionathletics.com/news/2019/5/17/mens-track-and-field-josh- boateng-named-ustfccca-south-central-region-field-athlete-of-the-year.aspx === 2020 === Josh Opened his 2020 Campaign at the Corky Classic hosted by Texas Tech. He earned a provisional mark in the men's shot put at 16.50 meters (54-1 ¾) on his first throw of the season, ranking 17th in the nation.https://lionathletics.com/news/2020/1/18/lions-open-spring-semester- with-solid-showing-at-corky-classic.aspxhttp://www.ntxe- news.com/artman/publish/article_118447.shtml ==Competition record==
